The property which was written by my grandfather Potti Deiva Sahaan Garu, has come to us as a result of Hindu inheritance and we have full right of possession. Rather than keeping the said property as joint, with the intention of dividing it so that each of them can develop their share, the property of our joint family, as per the will of our family elders and with our consent, has been divided into two unequal shares, namely 'A' and 'B', and the value of the property in Schedule 'A' is Rs. 6,00,000-00 and the income is received by the share of the 1st person, Poturaju Peda Mariamma, while the value of the property in Schedule 'B' is Rs. 1,50,000-00 and the value of the property in Schedule 'B' is Rs. 1,50,000-00 and the share of the 2nd, 3rd, 4th persons, namely 2 Mojesh, 3. Dilip, 4. Mary Agnesh. From this, they should be the full rightful owners of their share of the property, paying all the works of the Panchayat, etc., and their sons and grandsons should enjoy it freely with the rights of exchange, sale, donation, etc. About this
Muria
Pothuraju Pedda

Disputes like intellectual property rights, communal rights, etc. are always a matter of dispute, no matter who caused the dispute, we can resolve them all. It is not permissible to claim that there are any differences in the share, whether there are any advantages or disadvantages, or if one person has done any harm to another. For the registration of your names in this property, we can write and file notice forms. The survey number, boundaries and limits of this property are correct. There are no debts or dues due to our family. If there are any debts, then they are in their names and no one else has any connection with them. Any disputes regarding the above properties can be resolved by their respective shares. There are no other movable or immovable properties that we have to share. There are no other heirs to the said property except us. This property has not been assigned by the Government. It is not a property given as a 'D' title. We are bound by Ordinance 9/77. 1. sections.content: The property acquired by Pothuraju Peda Mariyamma, by virtue of Partition Deed No. 2874 of 2019, dated 27/May/2019, being Schedule A, measuring an extent of 145.2 Sq.Yds, bearing house number 4-183, Assessment No.797, comprised in survey number 90/2, situated in Kumudavalli Village, Palakoderu Mandal, within the District of West Godavari, registered at sub-registrar office Gunipudi, is bounded as follows: North by: House of Pothuraju Moshenu South by: Bodhi East by: House of Pothuraju Suvaranna Raju West by: Panchayathi Road Note: It is to be noted that our legal verification is limited towards the property offered as security for the purpose of loan, i.e., Schedule-A, property of the Partition Deed.

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
